Text: R Re your mail Cc PST Hi you have to use tapply A small example region cAtl Mount Atl state cNY AR WAS pop c d dataframeregionstatepop note that region and state are coerced to factors by dataframe tapplydpop dregion sum Atl Mount A very similar example was in An introduction to R for version I think it is in the current version too best wishes Ott Toomet On Wed Jan Erin Hodgess wrote Dear R People Here is a very simple question please I have a data frame with the state name state division and population Note state division is something like Atlantic Mountain etc I want to produce a table with the state division and the total of the populations for the states within that division Ive been messing with table but so far no luck This is R on Windows thanks in advance Sincerely Erin Hodgess Associate Professor Department of Computer and Mathematical Sciences University of Houston Downtown Main Street Houston TX mailto rhelp mailing list Read hornikRRFAQhtml Send info help or unsubscribe in the body not the subject To rhelp mailing list Read hornikRRFAQhtml Send info help or unsubscribe in the body not the subject To
